title: Bagdadia khaoensis
text:
Bagdadia khaoensis is a <a href="moth">moth</a> in the family <a href="Gelechiidae">Gelechiidae</a>. It was described by Kyu-Tek Park and Margarita Gennadievna Ponomarenko in 1999. It is found in <a href="Thailand">Thailand</a> and <a href="Hainan">Hainan</a>, China.
The length of the forewings is 8-9.5 mm. The ground colour of the forewings, as well as the markings are identical to those of "<a href="Bagdadia%20salicicola">Bagdadia salicicola</a>". The hindwings are grey.
The larvae feed on "<a href="Dimocarpus%20longan">Dimocarpus longan</a>".
